title: Whiskeytown National Recreation Area: Amphibians
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Amphibians                Amphibians        Pacific giant salamander (Dicamptodon ensatus) NPS PHOTO    Whiskeytown's many perennial creeks and shaded mid to high elevation forests support a diverse group of amphibian species. The park is home to six frog and toad, three salamander, two ensatina, and one newt species. Of these, two species (foothill yellow-legged frogs and tailed frogs) are federal species of concern, and one species (bullfrog) is a highly destructive non-native invader.  Download Whiskeytown's amphibian and reptile list (pdf, 48K).
